Posts.Title: Breast Cancer met to bone

Posts.Content: I have arthritis in my lumbar spine. Pet and mri showed lyric lesion. I had a Bone biopsy to confirm diagnosis. It was a met. On xeloda now. Changed diet drastically with supplements. Feel great. Www.xeloda.com Oral chemo...no side effects to speak of....can take for years to control progression. Check it out.
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc

Posts.Content: I was initially diagnosed stage I back in 2002 The bone biopsy cells were consistant with the original tumor. Make sense? Small focus. Hopefully we will get it! It's a disease you MUST remain diligent with. Tell me more about your situation. Kim
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc

Posts.Content: Wow. Thankyou! I am doing much of what you said including the coq10. How are you oing?
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc

Posts.Content: I have one lesion on my L4 vertebrae. No pain or anything yet. Bone density test showed no bone loss in two years. That was good too. It's a battle but I love life so much I will fight as long as possible. I started a new nutrition plan. Lots of supplements. I feel like a million bucks. Everything i eat is plant based. what a difference! The nutrition is fighting the cancer too along with the chemo. Do that for yourself. The medications and surgeries do not prevent future occurrences. Changing your diet will!, I can not believe how different I feel....no aches or pains...energy galore. Vitamin D....have y ou had your D level checked? This is a big one. Ties right in to breast cancer. I am taking vitamin d supplements...b12, Oncolite, estro-dim. Mushroom maitaike and many others You need to do everything you can for yourself...not just what oncology tells us. Keep in touch.
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc

Posts.Content: Your story could have been written by me! So many similarities. I am taking xeloda now. One more round and I will be retested (Petscan). I discovered the natural way during this treatment so hopefully the combo of the new way of eating, supplements and the xeloda will kill this little bugger. I feel so good. No more foggy brain, no pain, no side effects...nothing. End of may I will know if I am responding well, best of luck to you too. Keep in touch.
